short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Reload an unpacked extension with one click, a hotkey, or automatically (extension for developers).

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
üìö Documentation: https://github.com/loftyshaky/advanced-extension-reloader/blob/master/README.md#content

üì∫ Demo Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A7Kk7nb9i9E

Advanced Extension Reloader has been updated to version 2.0.0, introducing several changes to the API. For more details, please refer to the documentation linked above.

Advanced Extension Reloader is a browser extension that simplifies extension development by allowing you to reload your unpacked extensions with a single click, hotkey or automatically when files change. It features audio notifications to confirm reloads.

Features:

üéØ Reload a specific extension by targeting an extension with a specific ID.

‚å®Ô∏è Reload extensions using a hotkey.

üîÑ Set up automatic reloading of your extensions when their files change using the supplementary npm packages Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 1 (for development without a bundler) or Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2 (for development with a bundler).

üîî Receive audio notifications when your extensions are successfully reloaded.

üìÑ Reload the current tab or all open tabs after your extensions are reloaded (useful for content scripts).

‚ôªÔ∏è Advanced Extension Reloader will also reopen the popup and any tabs that were closed during the reload process, including your extension's options page.
----------------------------------------------------------------
üîê Permissions

Read your browsing history
Allows the extension to reopen tabs that were closed during the reload.

Manage your apps, extensions, and themes
Enables the extension to reload other extensions.
----------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------
Ads

When using Advanced Extension Reloader, you might encounter affiliate links on the extension's settings page.
